attributes.action: Give A-level students their UCAS teacher predictions if schools close in the UK.
attributes.background: If schools close down in the best interest of public health due to COVID-19, this will ruin A-level students chances of getting their potential grades. Furthermore content will not be able to be taught in time and pressure on students to learn this and make revision notes is just unfair.

rejection.details: Decisions about exams are a matter for exam boards and individual schools, and are not a matter for the UK Government or Parliament.
